citation.article-title: Reassessment of the systematics of the suborder Pseudonocardineae: transfer of the genera within the family Actinosynnemataceae Labeda and Kroppenstedt 2000 emend. Zhi et al. 2009 into an emended family Pseudonocardiaceae Embley et al. 1989 emend. Zhi et al. 2009
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the suborder Pseudonocardineae Stackebrandt et al. 1997 emend. Zhi et al. 2009

Pseudonocardineae (Pseu.do.no.carâ€²di.ne.ae. N.L. fem. n. Pseudonocardia the type genus of the suborder; N.L. suff. -ineae ending to denote a suborder; N.L. fem. pl. n. Pseudonocardineae the Pseudonocardia suborder).
Aerobic, mesophilic or thermophilic, catalase-positive actinomycetes comprising the family Pseudonocardiaceae, including the former members of the family Actinosynnemataceae.
Morphology, chemotaxonomy, phylogeny and 16S rRNA signature nucleotides are those of the family Pseudonocardiaceae.
The type genus is Pseudonocardia Henssen 1957 (Approved Lists 1980) emend. Park et al. 2008.
